law.text: When a person is held for trial by general court-martial, the commanding officer shall, within eight (8) days after the accused is ordered into arrest or confinement, if practicable, forward the charges, together with the investigation and allied papers, to the person exercising general court-martial jurisdiction. If that is not practicable, the commanding officer shall report in writing to that person the reasons for delay.
law.history: Amended 2013 Ky. Acts ch. 32, sec. 34, effective June 25, 2013. -- Created 1954 Ky. Acts ch. 99, sec. 32, effective July 1, 1954.
